title: Michael Gledhill
text: Email: michael6gledhill@gmail.com | Phone: 2707741565 | LinkedIn: michael-gledhill-65a153389

title: Michael Gledhill
text:
SUMMARY
Disciplined, mission-focused leader with experience in aviation, emergency services, and structured team operations through the Civil Air Patrol. Proven ability to manage training programs, develop cadets, coordinate operations, and strengthen organizational readiness. Demonstrates high-reliability decision-making, technical problem-solving, and operational discipline.

title: Michael Gledhill
text:
EDUCATION
Brigham Young University–Idaho (Online)
Associate’s Degree, Computer Science (In Progress)
February 2024 – December 2032
Current GPA: 4.0
Homeschool Graduate (K–12)
Completed a full K–12 homeschool program, developing strong self-management, discipline, and independent learning capabilities.

title: Michael Gledhill
text:
EXPERIENCE

Cadet Commander
Civil Air Patrol – Heartland Composite Squadron | Elizabethtown, Kentucky
June 2024 - Present

Led and mentored 30+ cadets, improving leadership development, emergency services readiness, and team performance; increased cadet advancement rates by 20% over 12 months
Directed weekly operations for 30–50 participants, coordinating training, instruction, safety, logistics, and mission-focused activities
Implemented structured progression and training plans, achieving 95% mission readiness compliance across squadron programs
Earned Student Pilot Certificate and soloed in a single-engine aircraft, completing 15+ solo flight hours



3D Printer Repair Specialist
Remote Care Partners Center | Kentucky
September 2023 - June 2024

Repaired and maintained 30+ 3D printers, reducing equipment downtime by 30% and improving production reliability
Resolved 100+ technical issues across multiple printer models, ensuring consistent, high-quality medical device output
Collaborated with production and engineering teams to optimize printer workflows, accelerating device turnaround by 15% and supporting delivery of 100,000+ medical devices



Independent Seller / Electronics Resale Business (eBay)
Self-Employed | 2023 – Present

Operate a small-scale resale business focused on harvesting and selling components from older versions of medical devices, including Raspberry Pis, speakers, motors, display modules, and other electronic parts.
Evaluate, test, and prepare items for resale, maintaining consistent quality and accurate technical descriptions.
Manage listings, customer communication, inventory control, and shipping logistics with a track record of reliable fulfillment.

title: Michael Gledhill
text:
TOP SKILLS
Leadership & Development:
Leadership & Mentorship • Training & Operations Oversight • Cadet Development • Crisis Management
Operations & Management:
Program Management & Planning • Organizational Coordination • Operational Discipline • Decision-Making
Technical Skills:
Basic Python • Basic SQL • Computer Science Coursework

title: Michael Gledhill
text:
Resume
Email
LinkedIn
GitHub





Hi, I’m Michael Gledhill, Cadet Commander at Civil Air Patrol’s Heartland Composite Squadron. I lead and mentor 30+ cadets while managing training programs and emergency services operations. As a 3D printer repair specialist, I reduced equipment downtime by 30% and resolved 100+ technical issues for medical device production. I’m a certified student pilot with 15+ solo hours. I combine leadership, technical expertise, and operational discipline to drive mission-focused results.

title: Michael Gledhill
text: Hi, I’m Michael Gledhill, Cadet Commander at Civil Air Patrol’s Heartland Composite Squadron. I lead and mentor 30+ cadets while managing training programs and emergency services operations. As a 3D printer repair specialist, I reduced equipment downtime by 30% and resolved 100+ technical issues for medical device production. I’m a certified student pilot with 15+ solo hours. I combine leadership, technical expertise, and operational discipline to drive mission-focused results.

title: Michael Gledhill
text:
Recent Projects
Links to your latest projects, case studies, and portfolio work will be posted here.



Project
Description

Photo Metadata App
Extract and organize photo metadata with an intuitive interface
View


CyberPatriot Runbook
Cybersecurity operations and hardening procedures
View


Project 3
Description
View





About Me
I’m a disciplined, mission-focused leader with hands-on experience in aviation, emergency services, and team operations. My background includes:

Leadership: Leading 30+ cadets, managing weekly operations for 50+ participants, developing structured training programs
Technical Skills: 3D printer maintenance and troubleshooting, basic Python and SQL, computer science coursework
Aviation: Student Pilot Certificate with 15+ solo flight hours in single-engine aircraft

I’m pursuing opportunities where I can contribute to mission-focused teams while continuing to develop as a professional.

title: Civil Air Patrol
text:
I have been a member of the Civil Air Patrol for two and a half years and currently serve as the Cadet Commander of the Heartland Composite Squadron. I hold the rank of Cadet Captain, and I advanced on time every two months all the way up through my current grade.
I completed my basic encampment in Florida during the 2022–2023 cycle, and I have since attended a total of three encampments and three National Cadet Special Activities. My time in CAP has focused on leadership development, aviation, emergency services, and guiding cadets through structured, mission-driven training.

title: Civil Air Patrol
text:
Summary
Motivated Civil Air Patrol cadet with strong leadership, cybersecurity, and aviation experience. Proven under pressure, highly driven, and committed to excellence. Passionate about aerospace, technology, and service. Aspires to become a U.S. Air Force pilot.

title: Civil Air Patrol
text:
Contact Information
Michael Gledhill | Cadet Captain, Civil Air Patrol
906 Silktree Cir, Elizabethtown, KY 42701
(502) 269-2525 | c_mgledhill@kywg.cap.gov

title: Civil Air Patrol
text:
Skills & Certifications
CyberPatriot:
Team Captain; National Semifinalist (2023 & 2024)
CAP Certifications:
GES, ICUT, SET, CERT, MRO, MSA, UDF, GTM3*
FEMA ICS:
IS-100, 200, 368, 520, 700, 800

title: Civil Air Patrol
text:
Awards & Achievements

2× Achievement Ribbons – CyberPatriot leadership & Encampment staff
3× Encampment Ribbons, 3× NCSA Ribbons, Recruiter Ribbon, 2× Community Service Ribbons
Rocketry Badge, STEM Badge, Powered Solo Wings, Search and Rescue “Find”
AFA Cadet of the Year

title: Civil Air Patrol
text:
Leadership Experience
Civil Air Patrol Member | Since June 2023
Advanced quickly to C/Capt; earned honor credit through Mitchell Award. On track to be promoted to Captain on September 8.
Roles Held: - Cadet Commander - Flight Commander - Public Affairs Officer - Aerospace & Communications NCO - Assistant Safety NCO - CAC Rep (Group & Wing)

title: Civil Air Patrol
text:

Graduate – Florida Winter Encampment (2024)

title: Civil Air Patrol
text:

Multiple Cyber Academies
SUPT-FC - TX

text:

title: Civil Air Patrol
text:

title: Civil Air Patrol
text:
Career Goals
Serve as a U.S. Air Force pilot. Interests include commercial aviation and aircraft systems or maintenance engineering.
